text: Shout out to Pete Davidson who lost his father in 9/11, suffers from BPD, anxiety and heavy depression, still didn’t became a nazi.
Depression Drugs Will Fix All Work Related Issues
ADHD and Depression
I’ve been depressed lately, but today has been good.
I have COVID and my dad sent me this after telling me I’m faking it and I just have depression to get me to go to school
Explaining My Depression to My Mother- Sabrina Benaim
Share of the population reporting chronic depression (2019)
Highly ruminative individuals with depression exhibit abnormalities in the neural processing of gastric interoception

Anxious 1st post here: I got a job today! While this might not seem like much to others; I was once a guy who worked in IT & even helped NASA at one point! 7 Years of not working, depression & trauma, I'm starting my life over from scratch..& I'm damn proud of that! 💚 Hope you smile!
Seasonal depression hitting hard. Could use a pick me up
“Incels” are not particularly right-wing or white, but they are extremely depressed, anxious, and lonely, according to new research
The need is not for new depression drugs but…
Walking in nature decreases negative feelings among those diagnosed with major depressive disorder

The bay is depressing after visiting Tokyo To be clear I enjoy living here because I genuinely love being being around other smart people working on insane things, and the open minded culture of the Bay Area in general.
Having said that, this place and western cities in general need some fixing. If you’ve ever visited any major East Asian city, it’s pretty clear how terrible it can be here in literally any measurable metric compared to them. I recently got back from Tokyo and to be quite honest, It’s depressing man. People let their kids run around. They trust each other. There aren’t homeless people on every single fucking intersection of the ENTIRE FUCKING CITY. They have transit that works exceptionally and people aren’t smoking weed or robbing you on the train. 
I realize this will be downvoted, but I urge anyone who hasn’t been to visit Tokyo or Singapore, and come back and tell me with a straight face and tell me I’m wrong

According to my mother, having a baby would cure my depression. I (F25) have autism, depression and anxiety. Yesterday while talking to my mother about the new meds my doctor prescribed me, I saw her face lit up with joy as an amazing idea occured her:  "you should have a baby! They are such blessings and would make you so happy".
Yeah, mom. Getting pregnant and having to quit my medications would really help me. Also, the 18+ years of not being able to care for myself would be awesome for my mental health.

Should i sacrifice my happiness and life for my mom dad or be selfish and let them die of depression and loneliness? EDIT: i dont mean i want to leave my parents forever, i m just seeking answers from people who were in similar situation because of work/location issues. i am always going to take care of parents with everything, just looking for solution with middle ground. 
​
I am in a tough position of my life. I am from a small town where my parents live, BUT my work and friends are in a major metro city in india.
my mom has depression and high Blood pressure problem. my dad and my mom wants me to live in my hometown and provide them support and company. they are both in age group of 55-60.
​
but i dont want to continue living with them. i want to live with my friends in city where i had already lived for more than 5 years now. i adjusted well in metro city and made good connections. i was physically and mentally fit with great social life.  but in my hometown i have no friends, no good facilities, nothing.
​
Please tell me what to do?
TLDR: if i stay in my small hometown for my parents' happiness, i ll die of depression and loneliness. but if i move back to metro city, i ll enjoy my freedom and happiness but my parents will die of depression and loneliness.

Most of the things we consider "mental illnesses" nowadays (like depression or anxiety), are just normal reactions to living in such a horrifyingly toxic capitalistic society. All of the suffering that we face as human beings is manufactured for profit. Change my mind.
Goo Goo Dolls, shrink my crippling depression

Lighting candles by myself feels more depressing than I anticipated I'm home alone for the first time in a long time, for 2.5 weeks, so basically the whole "holiday season". Really alone. I don't have family or friends or nearby neighbours. My daughter might stop by now and then but she didn't answer since I texted this morning. So I think I'm fine with it, but also I have these feelings. 
I don't even have a proper Hannukiah I made this one out of an empty Kleenex box wrapped in foil. 
Anyway, I did the thing. The Sun has set, there's 3 stars in the sky, and I sang to my little candles and watched them burn down.
Chag sameach to all the Jewish witches out there. Blessed be 💚✨💚✨💚

This sub is depressing af Everyone hates their lives, can’t get laid, wants to die, etc. I double dog dare y’all to comment on this post with something wholesome and positive that has happened to you recently/you’ve witnessed. I dare you to comment with something that you actually LIKE about yourself or your life. 
I’ll go first: I recently left a job in which the environment was very toxic and negative and started a new job. I love it! Everyone is really friendly and welcoming, I feel good about the work I do, and I feel appreciated. They care about ergonomics and me being physically comfortable. The training was very thorough and I feel like I’m set up for success. Polar opposite of how I felt at my last job. So hooray for that! :)

Games that help to deal with loss and depression As the title suggests, I'm going through some really tough times lately (lost most of my family in a span of two years) and I'm looking for games, that can occasionally help to just... forget about everything for a while and have some fun.
It doesn't necessarily have to be a "cosy" type of games. I'm open to all kinds of suggestions. I would just prefer it to not be something that directly deals with death or other heavy topics.
Thank you in advance
EDIT: Once again, thanks to all of you for trying to help and giving many amazing suggestions. 
I also want to assure everyone, that I understand the importance of properly working through grief. I'm working on it. 
What sparked this post, is that I'm currently in the middle of preparations for funeral of one of my closest family members, who gave me home when I needed it as a child long time ago. So it's even harder than other funerals and I really need a bit "escape" from all of this.
EDIT 2: I'm truly floored with the amount of amazing suggestions and thoughtful messages. I'm reading through all of it and trying to respond to most of the comments. Hopefully this post will not only help me but also many others who are in the similar situation.
And for all of you that are currently in similar situation: Please don't loose hope. As you can see even in this post, there are countless amazing people with huge hearts that want to help. Sometimes all you need to do, is to reach out and ask for help. You are not a burden for others and you are not alone.

I dare you to comment with something that you actually LIKE about yourself or your life. 
I’ll go first: I recently left a job in which the environment was very toxic and negative and started a new job. I love it! Everyone is really friendly and welcoming, I feel good about the work I do, and I feel appreciated. They care about ergonomics and me being physically comfortable. The training was very thorough and I feel like I’m set up for success. Polar opposite of how I felt at my last job. So hooray for that! :)

Games that help to deal with loss and depression As the title suggests, I'm going through some really tough times lately (lost most of my family in a span of two years) and I'm looking for games, that can occasionally help to just... forget about everything for a while and have some fun.
It doesn't necessarily have to be a "cosy" type of games. I'm open to all kinds of suggestions. I would just prefer it to not be something that directly deals with death or other heavy topics.
Thank you in advance
EDIT: Once again, thanks to all of you for trying to help and giving many amazing suggestions. 
I also want to assure everyone, that I understand the importance of properly working through grief. I'm working on it. 
What sparked this post, is that I'm currently in the middle of preparations for funeral of one of my closest family members, who gave me home when I needed it as a child long time ago. So it's even harder than other funerals and I really need a bit "escape" from all of this.
EDIT 2: I'm truly floored with the amount of amazing suggestions and thoughtful messages. I'm reading through all of it and trying to respond to most of the comments. Hopefully this post will not only help me but also many others who are in the similar situation.
And for all of you that are currently in similar situation: Please don't loose hope. As you can see even in this post, there are countless amazing people with huge hearts that want to help. Sometimes all you need to do, is to reach out and ask for help. You are not a burden for others and you are not alone.
